name: Foundry Steamboat Springs
description: Comprehensive substance use recovery programs combining therapy, mindfulness, and wellness.
eligibility: Adults seeking substance use or co-occurring treatment; clinical assessment required.
howToApply: Call intake line or complete web contact form for pre-screening.

name: Crime Victim Compensation (CVC)
description: State programs that may reimburse medical, counseling, lost wages, and other costs for eligible crime victims.
eligibility: Varies by state; generally requires reporting the crime and cooperating with law enforcement.
howToApply: Use the OVC directory to find your state's CVC office and follow their application steps.

name: DisasterAssistance.gov
description: Find and apply for federal assistance after disasters, including housing, medical, and counseling support.
eligibility: Residents in federally declared disaster areas; program-specific requirements apply.
howToApply: Check current disaster declarations and apply online; you can also call the FEMA helpline.

name: VA Disability for PTSD
description: Monthly disability compensation and healthcare for eligible veterans with PTSD related to service.
eligibility: Veterans with qualifying service-connected PTSD; evidence requirements apply.
howToApply: Apply online via VA.gov or with a VSO; submit medical and service records.
languages: English; translation support via VA partners

name: VictimConnect Resource Center
description: Confidential referrals to financial assistance, counseling, legal aid, and other services for crime victims.
howToApply: Call, chat, or browse resources to get connected to local programs, including compensation.
hours: See website; chat often available weekdays

name: SAMHSA Treatment Locator
description: Search thousands of licensed treatment facilities nationwide.
howToApply: Search by ZIP code; contact facilities directly.

name: Travis House
description: Safe, structured housing supporting men in early recovery with peer accountability.
eligibility: Adults 18+ in recovery; sobriety verification and interview.
howToApply: Apply online; schedule interview; deposit may be required.
cost: Weekly program fee; limited scholarship beds

name: NARR Directory
description: Find certified recovery residences that meet national standards.
howToApply: Search directory; contact residences directly.

name: 988 Suicide & Crisis Lifeline
description: Free and confidential support for people in distress, prevention and crisis resources.

name: 211 (United Way)
description: Referrals for emergency food, shelter, utility assistance, and more.
languages: Varies; multilingual support in most regions

name: Colorado Legal Services
description: Legal help for low-income Coloradans in civil cases including housing and benefits.
howToApply: Apply online or by phone; intake availability varies by county.

name: Legal Aid Society (Directory)
description: Find your local Legal Aid office funded by the Legal Services Corporation.
howToApply: Enter your ZIP code to see local intake options.

name: Benefits.gov
description: Official U.S. government website for finding benefit and assistance programs.
howToApply: Use the Benefit Finder questionnaire; follow links to your state.

name: LIHEAP (Energy Assistance)
description: Helps eligible households with heating/cooling energy costs and weatherization.
eligibility: Income-qualified; priority for elderly, disabled, and households with young children.
howToApply: Find your state LIHEAP office via the website and follow application steps.

name: Housing Choice Voucher (Section 8)
description: Helps very low-income families, the elderly, and disabled afford decent, safe housing.
eligibility: Income-qualified by local PHA; waitlists common.
howToApply: Contact your local Public Housing Agency (PHA) to check waitlist status.
notes: Some PHAs open waitlists periodically; check frequently.

name: HUD Continuum of Care (CoC)
description: Local networks that coordinate housing and services funding for homeless families and individuals.
howToApply: Find your CoC on HUD Exchange and contact lead agencies for coordinated entry.

name: Medicaid Enrollment (CO)
description: Health First Colorado (Colorado's Medicaid Program) information and enrollment.
howToApply: Apply online or at county human services offices.

name: HealthCare.gov Marketplace
description: Enroll in health plans with premium tax credits and cost-sharing reductions, if eligible.
howToApply: Open enrollment or special enrollment after qualifying life events.

name: Colorado Workforce Centers
description: Job search assistance, training, and career services statewide.
howToApply: Register online then visit your local office for orientation.

name: Job Corps
description: Free education and vocational training program for ages 16–24.
eligibility: Ages 16–24; income and other criteria may apply.
howToApply: Submit interest form online; an admissions counselor will contact you.

name: Oxford House Directory
description: Peer-run sober living homes with shared responsibility and democratic operations across the U.S.
howToApply: Use the directory to contact a local house for interview and availability.
notes: Availability and house rules vary by location.

name: VA Vet Centers (Readjustment Counseling)
description: Confidential counseling for veterans, service members, and their families for combat and MST-related trauma.
eligibility: Veterans, service members, and certain family members; eligibility varies by service history.
howToApply: Find your nearest Vet Center and call for an intake; 24/7 call center available.

name: RAINN — National Sexual Assault Hotline
description: Confidential support and referrals for sexual assault survivors via phone and online chat.

name: National Domestic Violence Hotline
description: Safety planning, crisis counseling, and referrals for domestic violence survivors.

name: Crisis Text Line
description: Text HOME to 741741 to connect with a volunteer counselor for free, 24/7 support.

name: Veterans Crisis Line
description: Dial 988 then press 1 for confidential crisis support for Veterans, service members, National Guard and Reserve, and their loved ones.
notes: Chat and text options available via website.

name: SAMHSA National Helpline
description: Free, confidential, 24/7 treatment referral and information service for individuals facing mental and/or substance use disorders.

name: OVC Directory of Services for Crime Victims
description: Search victim assistance and compensation programs, including legal advocacy and counseling.
howToApply: Search by state or ZIP; contact listed programs directly.

name: EEOC — File a Charge of Discrimination
description: Guidance and intake for workplace discrimination and harassment, including retaliation and disability accommodations.
howToApply: Start a charge online or contact your nearest EEOC office.

name: HUD Housing Counseling Agency Finder
description: Free or low-cost counseling for renting, homebuying, credit, foreclosure avoidance, and disaster recovery.
howToApply: Search for nearby agencies and call to schedule an appointment.

name: Public Housing Agency (PHA) Contacts
description: Find your local PHA to apply for Section 8/HCV and public housing, check waitlists, and get application guidance.
howToApply: Use the directory to reach your local PHA and follow their process.

name: HUD-VASH for Veterans
description: Supports eligible homeless Veterans and their families with housing vouchers and case management through HUD and VA partnership.
eligibility: Veterans experiencing homelessness; VA eligibility and local availability apply.
howToApply: Contact your nearest VA medical center homeless program or PHA.

name: American Job Center Finder
description: Find local American Job Centers for job search, resume help, training, and supportive services (WIOA).
howToApply: Find a center and visit or call for orientation and enrollment.

name: Vocational Rehabilitation (State VR)
description: State VR agencies help people with disabilities prepare for, obtain, and retain employment.
howToApply: Select your state to find the VR agency and start an application.

name: Apprenticeship Finder
description: Search registered apprenticeships that combine paid work with training and credentials.
howToApply: Search opportunities and apply with sponsoring employers.

name: Findhelp (formerly Aunt Bertha)
description: Search nearby programs for food, housing, goods, transit, health, money, care, education, and work.
howToApply: Enter your ZIP code and contact programs directly from listings.

name: NAMI HelpLine
description: Information, support, and local referrals for individuals and families navigating mental health conditions.

name: SNAP — State Directory
description: Find your state’s SNAP office to apply for food assistance (EBT).
eligibility: Income-qualified; varies by household size and state rules.
howToApply: Use the directory to reach your state agency and apply online or in person.

name: WIC — Women, Infants, & Children
description: Nutrition education, breastfeeding support, and healthy foods for pregnant/postpartum individuals and young children.
eligibility: Pregnant, postpartum, and caregivers of children under 5; income and nutrition risks apply.
howToApply: Contact your local WIC clinic via the website finder.

name: HRSA Health Center Finder
description: Federally funded community health centers offering sliding-scale primary care, behavioral health, and dental.
howToApply: Search by ZIP and call clinics directly for intake and fees.

name: Medicare Extra Help (LIS)
description: Helps people with limited income/resources pay Medicare prescription drug costs.
eligibility: Income/resource limits apply; Medicare enrollment required.
howToApply: Apply online at SSA.gov or call for assistance.
languages: English, Spanish; other languages available via SSA

name: Public Defender Offices (Directory)
description: Find public defender agencies for criminal cases if you cannot afford an attorney.
howToApply: Use the directory to locate your jurisdiction and contact the office.

name: Clean Slate & Expungement Resources
description: Learn about state-specific expungement or sealing options and where to get help.
howToApply: Check your state’s resources and contact listed partners or legal aid.

name: Medicaid Non-Emergency Medical Transportation (NEMT)
description: Transportation to medical appointments for eligible Medicaid members.
eligibility: Medicaid eligibility; rules vary by state and plan.
howToApply: Contact your Medicaid plan or state Medicaid office for ride scheduling.
